original_title: 50,000 ’Ice’ drug users in SL: Survey reveals
original_body_lines: Preliminary findings of a national survey on the use of Methamphetamine, commonly referred to as ICE, have found that there are some 50,000 users of the drug in the country, Chairman of the National Dangerous Drugs Control Board Shakya Nanayakkara said.
"However, through our samples and findings from the teachers we are engaging with, we have found that 'ice' or Methamphetamine use in schools isn't as prevalent as feared," Nanayakkara said.
"Towards the end of 2022 there was a comparative increase in persons admitted to our rehabilitation centres," he said.
